title: Fox News host grills President Trump about cognitive test
description: "Fox News Sunday" host Chris Wallace interviews President Donald Trump, fact-checking him in real time about various assertions including that Joe Biden wants to "abolish" the police.

title: Trump gets fact-checked -- face to face
description: In a video clip released Friday by Fox News, "Fox News Sunday" host Chris Wallace previewed his interview with President Donald Trump, in which he fact-checked Trump in real time by questioning his assertion that Joe Biden wants to "abolish" the police.

title: How John Lewis befriended a young boy and changed his life forever
description: When she saw the news Friday night that John Lewis had died, Lauren Annarino of Johnson City, Tennessee, picked up the phone to make a dreaded call to her 12-year-old grandson.

title: China's ambassador to the US says America must make a 'fundamental choice'
description: • Exclusive interview: CNN's Fareed Zakaria sits down with Ambassador Cui Tiankai

title: 'He's unteachable': Doctor blasts Trump's latest mask remarks
description: Dr. Jonathan Reiner reacts to President Donald Trump's comments about a national mask mandate during an interview with Fox News' Chris Wallace.

title: Fareed: Biden's economic plan much better than Trump's approach
description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria breaks down the economic aspects of 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden's "Build Back Better" plan in comparison to President Donald Trump's practices.

title: China's Ambassador to the US says America must make a 'fundamental choice'
description: Ambassador Cui Tiankai joins Fareed to discuss Sino-American relations, Hong Kong's new security law and China's treatment of its Muslim Uyghur minority.

title: A comet will streak across the sky for the rest of the month. Here's how to watch.
description: Stargazers in the Northern Hemisphere should enjoy every opportunity to see the new Comet NEOWISE as it streaks across the evening sky for the rest of July.

title: The Amazon is being destroyed at record rates
description: As Brazil struggles to contain the coronavirus, the Amazon is also being destroyed at record rates under President Jair Bolsonaro's watch. CNN's Bill Weir reports.

title: Brain fog, fatigue, breathlessness. Long-term symptoms linger on for many coronavirus victims
description: Professional diver Emiliano Pescarolo contracted coronavirus in March and spent 17 days in hospital in the Italian port city of Genoa before being discharged on April 10.

title: Artist donates 1,800 paintings to a hospital, one for every employee
description: A hospital in Brooklyn received a special delivery this week during the coronavirus pandemic: A truckload of 1,800 paintings, one for every employee, each representing a flower.

title: August Alsina drops new song 'Entanglements' after confirmed relationship with Jada Pinkett Smith
description: Singer August Alsina is putting his own spin on the word "entanglement" with his new song that dropped late Saturday night.

title: State Department releases cable that helped spread claims coronavirus emerged from Chinese lab
description: The State Department has released a 2018 diplomatic cable noting that the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV) had "a serious shortage of appropriately trained technicians and investigators needed to safely operate this high-containment laboratory."

title: National Ice Cream Day: Fun facts about everyone's favorite frozen treat
description: I scream, you scream -- well, you know the rest.

title: Covid-19 has exposed India's failure to deliver even the most basic obligations to its people
description: Days before India lifted its nationwide lockdown on June 1, the country's health ministry issued a press statement with a triumphant headline. "15 countries with highest number of Covid-19 cases, with almost same population as India, have reported 34 times cases and 83 times deaths as reported in India," it said.

title: Black Lives Matter mural outside Trump Tower vandalized three times in one week
description: The Black Lives Matter street mural in front of Trump Tower in midtown Manhattan has been vandalized three times in one week, according to the New York Police Department.

title: John Lewis, civil rights icon and 'conscience of Congress,' dies at 80
Lawsuit claims Breonna Taylor lived for '5 to 6 minutes' after being shot
description: Breonna Taylor was briefly alive for "five to six minutes" after being shot, according to a claim made in a lawsuit filed by Taylor's mother against Brett Hankison, Myles Cosgrove and Jonathan Mattingly, the three Louisville Metro Police Department officers identified in connection to her death.

title: White House objects to Senate GOP push for more CDC money for coronavirus testing and tracing
description: The White House and Senate Republicans are at odds over the amount of funding that should be given to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in the next round of stimulus spending, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told CNN on Saturday.

title: Can a religious group that Beijing banned and called an 'evil cult' still operate in Hong Kong?
description: To the upbeat sounds of a blue-uniformed brass band, the rally proceeded through downtown Hong Kong.
